q: Life is like underwear, should be changed twice a day.
h:
“Life is like underwear, should be changed twice a day. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: When one does not have what one wants, one must want what one has.
h:
“When one does not have what one wants, one must want what one has.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: It's not what we do once in a while that shapes our lives, but what we do consistently.
h:
“It's not what we do once in a while that shapes our lives, but what we do consistently.” —
Tony Robbins

q: There are no constraints on the human mind, no walls around the human spirit, no barriers to our progress except those we ourselves erect.
h:
“There are no constraints on the human mind, no walls around the human spirit, no barriers to our progress except those we ourselves erect.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Do not ignore your gift. Your gift is the thing you do the absolute best with the least amount of effort.
h:
“Do not ignore your gift. Your gift is the thing you do the absolute best with the least amount of effort.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Empty yourself of everything - let the mind become still.
h:
“Empty yourself of everything - let the mind become still.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence
h:
“Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: A gentleman is one who puts more into the world than he takes out.
h:
“A gentleman is one who puts more into the world than he takes out.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: You are your best thing.
h:
“You are your best thing.” —
Toni Morrison

q: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
h:
“We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.” —
Unknown

q: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
h:
“The truth is rarely pure and never simple. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages.
h:
“The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier.
h:
“Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier.” —
Christopher Columbus

q: Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.
h:
“Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.” —
Aristotle

q: Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.
h:
“Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.” —
Denis Waitley

q: Whatever you think the world is withholding from you, you are withholding from the world.
h:
“Whatever you think the world is withholding from you, you are withholding from the world.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
h:
“What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?” —
George Eliot

q: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
h:
“With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
h:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.” —
Bette Midler

q: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.
h:
“Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.” —
Bob Dylan

q: In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
h:
“In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Remember where you came from, where you're going, and why you created this mess you got yourself into in the first place.
h:
“Remember where you came from, where you're going, and why you created this mess you got yourself into in the first place.” —
Richard Bach

q: As you grow older you will discover that you have two hands. One for helping yourself, the other for helping others.
h:
“As you grow older you will discover that you have two hands. One for helping yourself, the other for helping others.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Conquer the devils with a little thing called love.
h:
“Conquer the devils with a little thing called love.” —
Bob Marley

q: The merit of all things lies in their difficulty.
h:
“The merit of all things lies in their difficulty.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
h:
“An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: The biggest challenge after success is shutting up about it.
h:
“The biggest challenge after success is shutting up about it.” —
Criss Jami

q: it's important to make sure that we're talking with each other in a way that heals, not in a way that wounds.
h:
“it's important to make sure that we're talking with each other in a way that heals, not in a way that wounds.” —
Barack Obama

q: Whatever you decide to do, make sure it makes you happy.
h:
“Whatever you decide to do, make sure it makes you happy.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.
h:
“If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
h:
“Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Values are like fingerprints. Nobody's are the same, but you leave 'em all over everything you do.
h:
“Values are like fingerprints. Nobody's are the same, but you leave 'em all over everything you do.” —
Elvis Presley

q: The unthankful heart discovers no mercies; but the thankful heart will find, in every hour, some heavenly blessings.
h:
“The unthankful heart discovers no mercies; but the thankful heart will find, in every hour, some heavenly blessings.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: If you practiced for the day, then you have won. If you were lazy for the day, then you have lost.
h:
“If you practiced for the day, then you have won. If you were lazy for the day, then you have lost.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: You must either modify your dreams or magnify your skills.
h:
“You must either modify your dreams or magnify your skills.” —
Jim Rohn

q: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
h:
“What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything? ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Never waste a minute of your precious life thinking about people you don't like.
h:
“Never waste a minute of your precious life thinking about people you don't like.” —
Celestine Chua

q: For changes to be of any true value, they've got to be lasting and consistent.
h:
“For changes to be of any true value, they've got to be lasting and consistent.” —
Tony Robbins

q: The first rule of handling conflict is don't hang around people who are constantly engaging in conflict.
h:
“The first rule of handling conflict is don't hang around people who are constantly engaging in conflict.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Life is essentially an endless series of problems. The solution to one problem is merely the creation of another.
h:
“Life is essentially an endless series of problems. The solution to one problem is merely the creation of another.” —
Mark Manson

q: The foolish reject what they see, not what they think; the wise reject what they think, not what they see.
h:
“The foolish reject what they see, not what they think; the wise reject what they think, not what they see.” —
Huang Po

q: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
h:
“Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.
h:
“Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Belief creates the actual fact.
h:
“Belief creates the actual fact.” —
William James

q: Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.
h:
“Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.” —
Elon Musk

q: Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.
h:
“Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
h:
“Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.” —
Alexander Pope

q: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
h:
“If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Only those who do nothing at all make no mistakes.
h:
“Only those who do nothing at all make no mistakes.” —
Unknown

q: Success and failure come and go, but don't let them define you. It's who you are that matters.
h:
“Success and failure come and go, but don't let them define you. It's who you are that matters.” —
Kamal Ravikant
